references.paper_title: Constitutional AI: Harmlessness from AI Feedback
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Constitutional AI, a novel approach to aligning AI systems with human values, which is highly relevant to the current paper's focus on using reinforcement learning from human feedback to improve the alignment of text-to-video generative models.

references.paper_title: Training diffusion models with reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper explores the use of reinforcement learning to train diffusion models, a technique directly relevant to the current paper's approach of using reinforcement learning from human feedback to improve text-to-video generation.

references.paper_title: Video generation models as world simulators
references.reason: This paper showcases impressive capabilities in text-to-video generative models, highlighting the potential applications of such models and directly motivating the current paper's work.

references.paper_title: ActivityNet: A large-scale video benchmark for human activity understanding
references.reason: This paper introduces ActivityNet, a large-scale video benchmark dataset that is used in the current paper to collect video data, showing the importance of this dataset to the work.

This paper introduces video diffusion models, which form the foundation for many of the current state-of-the-art text-to-video generative models and are therefore crucial to understanding the context of the current work.
